fields.name: Yamaha YFL-212 Flute
fields.description: The YFL-212 supersedes the popular Yamaha YFL-211 model, and is absolutely ideal for the beginning to step-up player. The added split E mechanism makes top E easier to play. With excellent build quality and easy sound production, it is capable of taking students from their very first notes to an advanced level. This classical flute is a good all rounder for students and above

fields.name: Pearl Flute
fields.description: Every Quantz model has French Pointed Arms. Once considered solely the domain of handmade flutes, it is now universally provided by Pearl. French Pointed Arms afford unmatched quickness of speed. When this is matched with the patented Pinless Mechanism, the combinations are dramatic. After all this time, the Pearl Quantz Series is still the only flute to use these features on every one of their flutes - a classical industry hallmark!

fields.name: Altus Flute
fields.description: The easy playing and reliable 1007 is the perfect choice when there is a greater need for resistance and a richer coloured resonance is desired. Its silvery character offers increased projection ability and evenness of tone. The 1107 and 1007 models are favoured by advanced woodwind students, woodwind doublers and teachers alike.

fields.name: Buffet Crampon Flute
fields.description: Buffet Crampon is a world renowned maker of woodwind instruments, with this particular flute falling under their student range of instruments. The 'Cooper' in the name of the flute refers to the Cooper Scale, as invented by Albert Cooper, which accurately determines the position and size of the flutes toneholes.

fields.name: Jupiter 700 Flute
fields.description: The Jupiter student flute is well-engineered to ensure good reliability and durability. The headjoint has been designed to be easy to produce a good sound on, and the .925 solid riser (a feature not usually found on flutes at this price level) improves the tone quality further. The flute comes in a light case and slimline shoulder bag, making it easy for school students to take to and from school.

fields.name: Germeinhardt Flute
fields.description: The Gemeinhardt M2S flute, in particular, is an excellent intermediate model. It boasts a solid silver head, body, and foot, along with a silver-plated mechanism. Consequently, it delivers a rich sound, ideal for advancing students.

fields.name: Pearl Piccolo
fields.description: The design of the Pearl PFP-105E piccolo is based on the legendary Hans Reiner piccolos, which are sought by professional players the world over. Compared to other instruments in this price range (and, in fact, some more expensive piccolos), the Pearl model produces a well-centred sound with good intonation. This piccolo is so good that many professional orchestral players use a Pearl 105 as their second instrument.

fields.name: Trevor James Piccolo
fields.description: Made of Grenadilla, also known as African Blackwood, this piccolo offers warmth and depth of sound usually associated with much more advanced instruments. The handcut reform-style headjoint is another standout feature, offering excellent response and clarity throughout the range from bottom to top.

fields.name: Burkart Piccolo
fields.description: he Resona (previously called Global) piccolo is a fantastic addition to the Burkart Flutes line of instruments. Aged grenadilla wood body with silver-plated keywork, this piccolo has a rich sound, good projection and easy control. Very playable, at a brilliant price.

fields.name: Amadeus Piccolo
fields.description: An impeccable pairing of uncompromising craftsmanship and cutting edge technology, the new Amadeus AP-86 grenadilla wood piccolo is distinctively Haynes. The responsive headjoint plays with ease, while the body and silver plated mechanism provides accurate intonation, balanced registers, and a liquid altissimo. The split-e mechanism is standard, and the choice of a Traditional or Wave style headjoint allows the player to choose the style which captures their imagination.

fields.name: Abell Wooden Flute
fields.description: Chris Abell's aim in flute-making is to produce instruments with a dark rich tone that only wood can give. Having worked at the famous Brannen Brothers workshop for many years, he has incorporated the best features of modern flute-making with the traditional sound of wood flutes; and he could be said to have started the Renaissance of the modern Boehm wood flute. Of the wood flutes produced today, no other has a sound like an Abell flute.

fields.name: Trevor James Grenadilla Wood Boehm System Flute
fields.description: Designed specifically for professional musicians seeking a high-quality wooden flute without straining their budget, the TJ Wooden Flute stands as a testament to our commitment to affordability and excellence. Its superb craftsmanship and exquisite tonal characteristics make it an ideal choice for those who already own a precious metal flute and crave the distinct qualities of a wooden instrument. Additionally, high-level students and dedicated amateurs will find immense pleasure and inspiration in the captivating sound and elegant aesthetics of this flute.

fields.name: Breeze-Easy Method 2 Flute
fields.description: Difficulty level, roughly compared to ABRSM exam grades. 0 is total beginner, 9 is advanced (beyond grade 8). An ideal guide for students.

fields.name: Learn To Play The Flute
fields.description: A carefully graded method that builds a sound rhythmic sense, develops well-rounded musicianship and emphasizes concepts of tone production. Ideal for beginners and advanced students alike.

fields.name: Spring Tunes for Solo Flute
fields.description: These five short pieces by Oistein Sommerfeldt are really of the open spaces of the his native Norwegian landscape. They are sensitively written, using the full range and colours of the flute to paint each miniature. Birdsong characterises the thoughtful Flute Tune, articulation helps The Brook babble along effectively, Spring Morning has the flute singing plaintively, the expansive Mountain Yearning seems to reflects the seasonal snowmelt and finally Spring Play in the Hills has the restless energy of expectation. This is a lovely piece of writing for solo flute which would enhance any concert at any time of the year!

fields.name: Duets for Flute and Guitar, Vol 1
fields.description: The first in a two-album series for flute and guitar conceived and produced by noted guitarist Ed Flower. This album offers a broad range of musical experience spanning the Renaissance and Baroque eras. Ed accompanies Jeremy Barlow in each duet. Become part of the most felicitous duet sound in music, the flute and guitar. Includes a -20% slow-tempo version of each piece to help you get up to speed.
